result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M. Meudt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Any/all counseling as deemed necessary/appropriate by DOC, including but not limited to a mental health evaluation/treatment.
Pursuant to sec.973.015, Wisconsin Statutes, upon successful completion of probation, defendants record to be expunged.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:06 AM Defendant Nicole M. Meudt in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Nicole M. Meudt.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation: Ct 1:  W/H 2 yrs probation:  counseling as recommended by DOC; $443 + $20 cps +$100 dvs; expungment.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
